intro: Racosperma alatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow or white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, featuring small, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. Racosperma alatum is often used in revegetation projects due to its resilience and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
